page.title: 19BUILDING MATERIALS
page.content: Building materials used in the area of Low Worsall,Low Middleton and the surrounding farming communities follow much the same pattern throughout the ages. A mixture of bricks,stone,timber and slate has been used. The older properties were largely constructed from 2 inch bricks and clay pantiles or sometimes a little slate was used.Both the bricks and pantiles originated from Holland. Perhaps this is evidence of the influence of Piersburg Port of Low Worsall. In contrast,modern buildings use a brick 8 by two and a half inches,wood,overlapping flat clay tiles and a greater use is made of glass and plastic.
